header.title: B. Engineering (Honours) and M. Engineering
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 80 units comprising:

  • 8 units for all BE(Hons)/ME Core Courses, and
  • 66 units for one Field of Study from BE(Hons)/ME Field of Study Options, and
  • 0 to 4 units from Preparatory Science and Mathematics Courses, and
  • 0 to 4 units from BE(Hons)/ME First Year Engineering Elective Courses, and
  • 0 to 6 units from BE(Hons)/ME Program Elective Courses, and
  • 0 to 6 units from General Elective Courses

header.notes:
During the first year of study students can choose to commence in their chosen specialisation or undertake the flexible first year. The flexible first year allows students to keep their options open as to which specialisation they chose to pursue in second year. 

Students wishing to follow a flexible first year enrolment must refer to EAIT Faculty resources for guidance in choosing First Year Engineering Courses. Find more information here.

Students will be required to choose their program specialisation by the commencement of second year.

selectionRule.text: Complete [N] to [M] units from the following:

header.title: General Elective Courses

payload.value:
1. Hurdle requirements

You must complete the following program-level hurdle requirement/s:

Professional practice

  • Successful completion of 430 hours of professional practice including all assessment relating to that professional practice.

2. Progression intervention

Academic standing in this program is subject to the following requirements in addition to the requirements in the Academic Progression Procedure:

  • If you fail any course in a study review period and you have not completed 48 units towards the program requirements, you will receive a progression alert.
  • If you fail any course in a study review period; and you have not completed 48 units towards the program requirements; and you have received a progression alert in a prior study review period within the program, you will be issued with a progression intervention notice.
  • If you have been issued with a progression intervention notice under subrule 2(2), you will be required to provide the Associate Dean (Academic) with a progression improvement plan demonstrating why you should be permitted to remain enrolled.

You will not be permitted to remain enrolled in the program if:

  • You do not submit a progression improvement plan by the due date, or
  • Your progression improvement plan is refused, or
  • You do not meet the conditions set on your enrolment by the Associate Dean (Academic).

Withdrawal without academic penalty does not count as failure to pass a course.

If you are not permitted to remain enrolled in the program under subrule 2(4):

  • You will be permitted to enrol in the Bachelor of Engineering (Honours), and
  • You may apply for readmission into the BE(Hons)/ME in a subsequent semester provided you meet the admission requirements.

3. Recognition of prior learning

This program is subject to the following credit limits in conjunction with Recognition of Prior Learning Policy and Procedure:

  • You must complete a minimum of 2 years of study, in an Engineers Australia accredited degree program, at an Australian University.

4. Class of honours

The grade point average for determining your class of honours is calculated based on: the weighted cumulative grade point average.

  • weighted cumulative grade point average means the average grade over all attempts at contributing courses where each course grade is weighted by the unit value of the course and the course level.
  • contributing courses means all courses undertaken at the university which count towards the BE(Hons), BE(Hons)/ME or which would have counted if passed but excludes courses where the student was awarded a final grade of ‘P’;
  • course grade means the final grade for that course if that grade is numeric, or, it means ‘2’ if the final grade is ‘N’ or otherwise it means ‘0’;
  • course level means —

(a) the fifth character of the course code where that character is 1,2,3, or 4,or

(b) 4 when the fifth character of the course code is a 5 or 6, or

(c) 5 when the fifth character of the course code is a 7 or higher

Refer to Bachelor Honours Degree Procedure for more information.

5. Exit awards

If you withdraw from this program after completing 48 units you may be apply to be awarded the Bachelor of Applied Technology with an undeclared major, subject to you:

(a) gaining credit for at least 42 units from the BE(Hons) and/or BE(Hons)/ME course lists, including 8 units for core courses, and

(b) gaining credit for at least 8 units of courses at level 3 or higher and no more than 24 units of courses at level 1.

Note see Program Design Procedure for further information.
